comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Gertrude Foster Brown (b. 1867 in Illinois) was president of the New York State Woman Suffrage Association in 1914.  She was trained as a musician, in Berlin and Paris.  She married Raymond Brown in 1893.  Besides her suffrage activities, Gertrude Foster Brown gave recitals, and lectures on Wagner.  (Her entry in the Women's Who's Who for 1914-1915 is on p. 134.)

comment.author: 47434837@N00
comment._content: The Women's who's who book for 1914-1915 is available on google books. Gertrude Foster Brown's mention is linked at books.google.com/books?id=34hmAAAAMAAJ&dq=Women's%20W...

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: pennylrichardsca: Thanks for the additional information on Gerturde Brown.  We'll include it in the description next time we update.
